5th grade will not have lockers. 6-7-8 grades will each have a locker.
We are excited to welcome the students back!

I want to express my deep gratitude to each of you during the end of this year. Since early in my education career, I have looked to John Wooden and his pyramid of success to help me lead. You took his two cornerstones and ran with them. Your "industriousness" and "enthusiasm" during this time became, pardon the pun, infectious. You took on the challenge to change how you do your job and made the best of a bad situation. Your hard work and willingness to change astounded me and I want to say THANK YOU! I am certain that no matter what the future holds we will overcome it through the two cornerstones you have already shown. RHS you make me proud.

RHS Principal
Kevin Kenelty

Global Youth Service Day (GYSD)

GYSD is the largest youth and civic action event in the world.
It aims to engage K-12 youth with community service.

Many people across the Flathead Indian Reservation have
been isolated due to the COVID-19 pandemic, so this year’s
event aims to boost community morale and increase
community engagement – while following social distancing and stay at home orders. In short, we are making a book to
showcase the creativity of community members.
We want to see what creative projects you have been working on since school has been out! Submit pictures of your creative expressions for inclusion in a community morale-boosting book.
Any K-12 youth are encouraged to participate!

Contact project coordinator Megan Ahern at (406) 270-9614
or ahern@mtcompact.org. She will send you a media release
form, and you just need to sign it and send it back along with a
picture or scan of the creative project you want to showcase.
Please note that submissions will be included in a book that
will either be published in hard copy or online!

https://leadasap.ysa.org/
